before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fl8gj","text":"Ensure in situ oven is at the desired temperature. We usually switch the oven on at the start of the day 1 and allow the oven to reach a stable temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4f52r","text":"This FISH protocol has been adapted for use in Fasciola hepatica, specifically 4-week-old juveniles, grown in vitro in 50% Chicken Serum, 50% RPMI culture medium. The majority of this protocol comes from those of the Newmark Lab (King and Newmark, 2013) and Collins Lab (Collins and Collins, 2017). We are grateful to members of these labs for several helpful discussions on this technique.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":47,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2u7ct","text":"Following a long period of relative success with this technique, we had noticed difficulties emerged. After trying various tweaks, we decided to purchase the vast majority of reagents again. This seemed to have helped significantly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7h1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76vuv","text":"For all steps prior to and including the riboprobe incubation, all tips and tubes should be RNase free. Reagents should be made up with DEPC-treated double distilled H2O - for 1 litre of DEPC-treated water, add 1ul Diethyl pyrocarbonate (D5758, Sigma) per 1ml of H2O. Shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Leave at room temperature overnight, or 2 hours at 37oC, then autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":167,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":264,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":354,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3on34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clvhk","text":"We have found that longer riboprobes (800-1000 bases) have generally worked better than shorter (150-300 bases) ones.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0evm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bko1","text":"Alongside every positive test, we run the sense probe as a negative control. This is especially helpful when we see probes with otherwise ambiguous/questionable staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qoic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8idbt","text":"Highlighted solutions have recipes at the bottom of the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d33q9","text":"Carry out excystment (see McVeigh et al., 2014), transfer newly excysted juveniles to 96-well round-bottomed plates, in groups of \u003c25 NEJs per well. Add 200μl of pre-warmed, pre-mixed 50:50 chicken serum (New Zealand Origin, 16110082, Thermo) and RPMI (11835030, Thermo). Replace this every other day. Worms are maintained in a   incubator with 5% CO2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":34,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":350,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":328,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bta8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"ED3AEE101A4211EE8A8CEB71206D1E2F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qj09","text":"Amplify target of interest with an end-point PCR using FastStart Taq polymerase, dNTPack (4738381001, Sigma). Primers should have a 5’-TAATACGACTCACTATAGGGT-3’ promoter sequence. For the antisense probe (positive) use the regular forward primer and the T7-tagged reverse primer. For the sense probe (negative control) use the T7-tagged forward and the regular reverse.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
